title: South Korea Launches First Homegrown Rocket and Satellite Into Space
sub_head: The technology could help expand Seoul’s military satellite surveillance of Kim Jong Un’s regime to the north amid heightened tensions
body:
SEOUL—South Korea launched its first homegrown rocket into space, harnessing a technology few countries possess and which can be used to expand Seoul’s military satellite surveillance of North Korea.
Only six other countries—including the U.S., China and Russia—possess domestically developed rockets that can carry a satellite weighing more than 1 ton into space.
